description: A one-sword style technique where the user jumps high into the air with one sword wielded in one hand (gripping the wrist with the other hand for support) and delivers a powerful downward slash. The opponent then bursts into flames from where they were slashed. In the anime, the flames are depicted as blue.

keyMoments.title: First Use Against Ryuma
keyMoments.description: Zoro debuts this technique to defeat the legendary zombie samurai Ryuma in their rooftop duel.
keyMoments.significance: The technique's first use results in a decisive victory against a legendary opponent and becomes one of Zoro's signature moves.

trivia.fact: The technique features a dragon motif that resembles the dragon Ryuma slayed in Eiichiro Oda's earlier one-shot manga 'Monsters'.

sources.title: Analyzing the nature of Zoro's Hiryu Kaen

trivia.fact: Zoro would later use this technique against Kaido in Episode 1017, demonstrating its power against even the strongest opponents.

sources.title: One Piece Episode 1017: Could 'Ittoryu: Hiryu Kaen' Defeat Kaido?

description: A fencing-style sword technique used by Ryuma. The name comes from French fencing terminology, with 'Aubade' meaning 'morning serenade' and 'Coup Droit' meaning 'straight thrust'.

keyMoments.title: Used Against Zoro
keyMoments.description: Ryuma demonstrates this technique during his duel with Zoro in Hogback's laboratory.
keyMoments.significance: Showcases Ryuma's unique blend of Eastern and Western swordsmanship.

description: A fencing-style sword technique used by Ryuma. The name combines 'Prelude' (an introductory piece) with 'Au Fer' (a fencing term for blade engagement).

keyMoments.title: Used Against Zoro
keyMoments.description: Ryuma demonstrates this technique during his duel with Zoro in Hogback's laboratory.
keyMoments.significance: Part of Ryuma's diverse arsenal of fencing-inspired techniques.

name.japanese: ガヴォットボンダヴァン

description: A fencing-style sword technique used by Ryuma. The name combines 'Gavotte' (a French folk dance) with 'Bond en Avant' (forward jump/leap in fencing).

keyMoments.title: Used Against Zoro
keyMoments.description: Ryuma demonstrates this technique during his duel with Zoro in Hogback's laboratory.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Ryuma's agile and dance-like fighting style.

description: A fencing-style sword technique used by Ryuma. The name combines 'Polka' (a lively dance) with 'Remise' (a fencing term for a renewed attack).

keyMoments.title: Used Against Zoro
